Question
========

Abby, Deborah, Sam, Tonya and Roberto work at a company. This year there is a conference in Paris. Two of the five get to go to it. The boss writes all the combinations on pieces of paper and puts them in a box. A combination is picked at random. What is the probability that both Sam and Roberto ***not*** are chosen? Note: this means that they also cannot can go with other people.

Answerlist
----------

* 1/10
* 2/10
* 3/10
* 5/10

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 1/10: Incorrect
* 2/10: Incorrect
* 3/10: Correct
* 5/10: Incorrect
